name: elective
content:
elective adjective
(MEDICAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a medical treatment) done at a time chosen by the patient, rather than needed urgently: elective surgery Medication should be stopped two days before elective surgery. This procedure was elective and non-urgent. She had her first child by an elective Caesarean section.
More examplesFewer examplesLaser eye treatment quickly became the most popular elective surgery in the country.While some elective surgeries were postponed, emergency and outpatient treatment continued as normal.She had recurrent tonsillitis and was admitted for an elective tonsillectomy.

elective adjective
(VOTING)
An elective position or system is one that involves people voting: elective office I am considering seeking elective office as a way to bring about change. At the beginning of the twelfth century, elective monarchy gradually gave way to hereditary monarchy in Europe.
More examplesFewer examplesThe British political party introduced rules requiring that 50% of elective offices be held by women.He referred to the country as "an elective dictatorship".His decision to retire from elective politics was not surprising.
